channel.title: Need help with xlogging out of my jail :/
channel.description:
Hey, i've made a jail and:
I've made it so, you go to a jail place.. you cant ::yell or do any :: commands.. or teleports.. or log out
i've basically used the teleblock function for this.. so like.. if you're in jail, teleblock = 1 - means you cant do any of the above..
However.. when you xlog you obviously become un teleblocked and therefore you can do those things, so how can i make it so the teleblock or whatever sticks until i use ::unjail on someone??
Any help would be great :D thanks

item.title: Need help with xlogging out of my jail :/
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

I’m not familiar with the ‘inJail’ method.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with xlogging out of my jail :/

item.title: Need help with xlogging out of my jail :/
item.dc:creator: @labeeb labeeb
item.source: Need help with xlogging out of my jail :/

item.title: Need help with xlogging out of my jail :/
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

In code form,

if(inJail()) teleblock = 1;

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with xlogging out of my jail :/

item.title: Need help with xlogging out of my jail :/
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

Check if they login inside the coordinates of the jail, and if so, set the teleblock integer back to 1.

This can be done in the initialize method.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with xlogging out of my jail :/
